alert.note: Alert for Cass (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 7:26PM CDT until June 04 at 8:06PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of west central Missouri, including the following counties, Cass, Jackson, Johnson MO, Lafayette and Ray. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 726 PM CDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kansas City, Overland Park, Independence, Lee`s Summit, Blue Springs, Leawood, Raytown, Grandview, Belton, Raymore, Grain Valley, Harrisonville, Pleasant Hill, Oak Grove, Odessa, Greenwood, Peculiar, Buckner, Holden and Lake Lotawana. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
